case_title: ZIKRIYA vs ASSISTANT COMMISSIONER, PISHIN AND 2 OTHERS

accussed_details.name: Nasrullah
allegation: Helping proclaimed offender Bismillah evade arrest
Act likely to cause danger to public tranquility

detention_details.security_demand: Rs. 50,000 with two sureties for three years

complaint_summary: Petition filed under Article 199 of the Constitution challenging the legality of detention of Nasrullah, accused of aiding a proclaimed offender, Bismillah.
investigation_summary: Assistant Commissioner issued notice under Section 17 of the Criminal Law (Special Provisions) Ordinance, 1968, requiring Nasrullah to furnish security for good behavior. Nasrullah denied allegations and refused to furnish security, leading to his arrest and detention.
judgment_summary: The court declared the notice issued to Nasrullah under Section 17 of the Ordinance as unlawful and his detention as illegal. The allegations did not meet the criteria under Section 17 for requiring security.
legal_arguments: Defense argued that allegations in the notice did not fall under Section 17 of the Ordinance.
Prosecution contended that aiding a proclaimed offender could indirectly lead to subversive activities, justifying security under Section 17.

court_findings.notice_validity: The notice did not meet the requirements of Section 17 of the Ordinance.
court_findings.detention_legality: Nasrullah's detention was declared unlawful as the notice lacked legal authority.

statutes: Article 199 of the Constitution of Pakistan
sections: Section 17 of Criminal Law (Special Provisions) Ordinance, 1968
Section 19 of Criminal Law (Special Provisions) Ordinance, 1968

precedents_cited.relevance: Action under similar provisions requires allegations of murder or culpable homicide.

precedents_cited.case_name: Raja Haq Nawaz v. Mohummad Afzal and others
Murree Brewery Company Limited v. Pakistan
precedents_cited.relevance: Jurisdictional defects in notices justify writ petitions.

key_issues: Legality of detention under Section 17 of the Ordinance
Jurisdiction of Assistant Commissioner to demand security

maxims.Certiorari Jurisdiction: Court can intervene when jurisdictional defects are apparent.

legal_terms.Proclaimed Offender: A person declared as evading arrest and involved in serious offenses.
legal_terms.Security for Good Behavior: A bond required to ensure compliance with lawful conduct.

words_and_phrases.Public Tranquility: State of peace and order in society.
words_and_phrases.Blood Feud: Conflict likely to lead to violence.

summary_vector_notes: The case revolves around the legality of detention under Section 17 of the Criminal Law Ordinance, 1968. The court found the notice issued to Nasrullah unlawful as the allegations did not meet the statutory requirements. The petition was allowed, and detention declared illegal.
